definition: to treat as/to regard as
at or in the very same.../suitable/adequate/fitting/proper/to replace/to regard as/to think/to pawn/(coll.) to fail (a student)
to be/to act as/manage/withstand/when/during/ought/should/match equally/equal/same/obstruct/just at (a time or place)/on the spot/right/just at
to do/to grow/to write or compose/to pretend/to regard as/to feel/writings or works
worker/workshop/(slang) troublesome/high-maintenance (person)

sentences.english: Can you use lipstick on your eyes?
sentences.chinese: 把脣線筆當作眼線筆使用或者反一反？

sentences.english: He took me for his housemaid .
sentences.chinese: 他把我當作他的女傭人了。

sentences.english: I started teaching ESL part-time (English as a Second Language) in 2003.
sentences.chinese: 當作兼職，我從2003年開始教非母語英語課程。

sentences.english: Do not take that commitment for granted.
sentences.chinese: 不要把承諾當作是理所應當的。

sentences.english: The owners of these experiences recognize them as fragmentary semimemories.
sentences.chinese: 這些過往經歷的主人把它們當作是零碎的半記憶片段。

sentences.english: Biomass may also include biodegradable wastes that can be burnt as fuel.
sentences.chinese: 生物量還包括能夠當作燃料燃燒的可降解廢料。

sentences.english: He mistook me for his old friend whom he hadn't seen for years.
sentences.chinese: 他把我當作他多年不見的老朋友了。

sentences.english: This measure may be an indicator of test effectiveness.
sentences.chinese: 這個測量可以當作測試效力的指示器。

sentences.english: Except Reimer never saw himself as a girl.
sentences.chinese: 但雷蒙從未將自己當作女孩看待。

sentences.english: And if it's taken as the whole truth, and nothing but the truth,it's detrimental.
sentences.chinese: 如果把這當作全部的真理，則是有害的。

sentences.english: Mary took him while her faudio-videoailable ather .
sentences.chinese: 瑪麗把他當作本身的父親。

sentences.english: But their quality call mainly fell on deaf ears in the U.
sentences.chinese: 但是他們在質量方面的呼籲在美國卻被當作耳旁風。

sentences.english: Some people regard friendship as a game.
sentences.chinese: 有的人把交朋友當作是逢場作戲。

sentences.english: I took you fMr Green from the Customs just now. May I know your name?
sentences.chinese: 我剛纔把你錯當作海關的格林先生了。請問尊姓大名？

sentences.english: Janine: Yeah. So it could be whatever.

sentences.chinese: 在中國，刀和布匹被當作錢用。

definition: to act as/used erroneously for 作為|作为
to view as/to see as/to consider to be/to deem
one's conduct/deed/activity/accomplishment/achievement/to act as/as (in the capacity of)/qua/to view as/to look upon (sth as)/to take sth to be
at or in the very same.../suitable/adequate/fitting/proper/to replace/to regard as/to think/to pawn/(coll.) to fail (a student)
to be/to act as/manage/withstand/when/during/ought/should/match equally/equal/same/obstruct/just at (a time or place)/on the spot/right/just at
mistake/error/to miss/to harm/to delay/to neglect/mistakenly
to think (i.e. to take it to be true that ...) (Usually there is an implication that the notion is mistaken – except when expressing one's own current opinion.)
only natural/as it should be/certainly/of course/without doubt
only/merely/nothing but/no more than/it's just that ...
so-called/what is called
these
after all/all in all/when all is said and done/in the final analysis
and so on/and such
surname Ying
to agree (to do sth)/should/ought to/must/(legal) shall
to answer/to respond/to comply with/to deal or cope with
to believe/to think/to consider/to feel
in a word/in short/in brief
to fit/balanced/suitable
to weigh/to state/to name/name/appellation/to praise
variant of 秤[cheng4]/steelyard
